article: We were on our way home from Houston one Saturday morning. We decided to _ at a local gas station to get something to drink _ all of us were thirsty.   When we were _ and got back to our car, we noticed a man _ outside the building. You could tell that he was a _ man. His clothes were worn and it looked like he had gone in and got himself something _ to drink since it was cold outside. He must have not had enough money to get something to _ . That is not something I _ very well, because that is not what " _ "me.   Then a dog walked up. Being a dog lover, I could tell she had been _ puppies . She was terribly in need of something to eat and I felt so _ for her. I knew if she didn't eat soon, she and her puppies would not _ it.   My wife and I sat there and looked at her. We noticed that people walked by and didn't even pet _ . She might not have been as pretty and clean as most, but she still _ better. We still did not do anything. But someone did. The homeless man, who I _ did not buy himself anything to eat, went back into the store. And what he did brought _ to us. With the only money he may have had, he bought a can of dog food and fed that dog.   This _ plays a great part in my life. That was Mother's Day weekend. And lots of people forget that some animals are _ too. A homeless man made me a _ man that day. He showed me what I should have done.
